title: The Bhungroo (Straw) - An Intervention for  water logging and irrigation in saline soils

tasks.task: Understanding Water Logging and Irrigation Process for Crops
subtasks: Note the initial water amount before monsoon (around 3-4 hours of water).
Understand the refill frequency during monsoon (3-4 times).
Identify the catchment area (Revolut channel) and total land area (20 acres, irrigating 50 acres).
Recognize the irrigation arrangement involves 7 women, all below-poverty-line, sharing the resource.
Learn about their alternative system where every 7th day they get irrigation turn.
Gauge the potential for improved irrigation with more machines.

tasks.task: Describing the Benefits of Bhoongru (Irrigation System)
subtasks: Compare the income before and after using the bhoongru (previously had no income, post-bhoongru, significant income from animals).
List the crops grown: wheat, castor, cumin, isopgul, and grass.
Mention the presence of a diesel engine (8 HP) and water pump for extraction.
Note the approximate diesel cost for a season (20,000-25,000).
